name: Modules.Bluetooth
summary: Allows a Titanium application to use Bluetooth service.

events.name: deviceFound
events.summary: Fired when the local Bluetooth adapter discovers a device.
events.description:
This event may get called several times for the same Bluetooth device in the range. For not listing the same Bluetooth device many times, one should add a check before adding it to the list. You can do following to avoid the above.

// Extract the device from this event properties.
  var device = e.device;
  var numRows = btDevicesListSection.rowCount; // count the number of rows in the section where rows are added.
  if(numRows > 0)
  {
    var rowArray = btDevicesListSection.rows; // Extract all the rows into an array.
    for(var i =0; i< numRows; i++)
    {
      //Check if the already added row with the id is same as newly found device.
      // The id is the property of the row. You should add device address into it.
      if(rowarray[i].id == device.address) 
      {
        //update the device info. Some devices might get updated and changed the friendly name.
        return;
      }
    }
  }

properties.name: RSSI
properties.summary: The RSSI value at the time of device discovery.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: discoveryFinished
events.summary: Fired when the local Bluetooth adapter finished discovery.

events.name: discoveryStarted
events.summary: Fired when the local Bluetooth adapter started discovery.

events.name: stateChanged
events.summary: Fired when the state of the local Bluetooth adapter changes.
events.description: Most possible reason for this event to occur is either bluetooth is turning on or off.

methods.name: cancelDiscovery
methods.description: As discovery is a heavyweight procedure for the Bluetooth adapter, this method should always be called before attempting to connect to a remote device via connect. Discovery is run as a system service, so an application should always call cancel discovery even if it did not directly request a discovery, just to be sure. If Bluetooth state is not STATE_ON or if there is no ongoing discovery process this function will return false. Listen for the discoveryFinished event to be notified when the device discovery process finished.

methods.name: checkBluetoothAddress
methods.summary: Validates a Bluetooth address, such as "00:43:A8:23:10:F0". Alphabetic characters must be uppercase to be valid.

parameters.name: address
parameters.summary: a string representing the address, such as "00:43:A8:23:10:F0".

returns.summary: Returns true if the address is valid, false otherwise.

methods.name: createServerSocket
methods.summary: Creates an object of Modules.Bluetooth.BluetoothServerSocket which can be used to listen for incoming connections.
methods.description: This method, when called, creates an object of Modules.Bluetooth.BluetoothServerSocket which can be used to listen for the incoming connection and accept it by calling the startAccept method. This method returns null, if Bluetooth is not supported on the device.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Dictionary which contains value for name, uuid and security level.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Listen for the stateChanged event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning off.

returns.summary: Returns true if the process is initiated successfully or when the bluetooth is already off.

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Listen for the stateChanged event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning on.

returns.summary: Returns true if the process is initiated successfully or when the bluetooth is already on.

methods.name: ensureDiscoverable
methods.summary: Make the local device discoverable to other devices.
methods.description: Displays a system activity that asks the user for permission to make the local device discoverable by other devices, and to turn on Bluetooth if it is not currently enabled. Change the scan mode to SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE_DISCOVERABLE. By default, the device becomes discoverable for 300 seconds, or 5 minutes. You can define a different duration, up to 3600 seconds or 1 hour.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.summary: It represents the time duration in seconds to make local device discoverable.

methods.name: getName
methods.summary: Gets the friendly Bluetooth name of the local Bluetooth adapter.

returns.summary: Name of the local Bluetooth adapter. In case of error it can be null.

methods.name: getPairedDevices
methods.summary: This method is use to get the devices that are paired to the local Bluetooth adapter.
methods.description: Returns the PairedDevicesType. In this if the paired devices are successfully fetched then the success will be true and can get array of paired devices with the pairedDevices. If it is false then we can get description of it via message If there's any issue fetching paired device, or if there no paired devices then this methods return false. Refer message for detailed reason of failure.

returns.summary: Dictionary of arguments passed by the method, e.g. success, message and pairedDevices

methods.name: getRemoteDevice
methods.summary: Get a Modules.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice object for the given Bluetooth hardware address.
methods.description: If Bluetooth is not supported on the device, this method return null.

parameters.name: address
parameters.summary: Valid Bluetooth hardware addresses must be upper case, in a format such as "00:11:22:33:AA:BB"..

methods.name: isDiscovering
methods.summary: Determines whether the local Bluetooth adapter is currently in the device discovery process or not.
methods.description: Device discovery is a heavyweight procedure. New connections to remote Bluetooth devices should not be attempted while discovery is in progress, and existing connections will experience limited bandwidth and high latency. Use cancelDiscovery to cancel an ongoing discovery. If Bluetooth is not supported on the device or Bluetooth state is not STATE_ON this function will return false.

returns.summary: true if the local Bluetooth adapter is currently in the device discovery process.

methods.name: isEnabled
methods.summary: Determines if Bluetooth is currently enabled and ready for use.
methods.description: If Bluetooth is not supported on the device, this method will return false.

returns.summary: Returns true if the local adapter is on.

methods.name: isRequiredPermissionsGranted
methods.summary: Determines whether the required permissions are granted or not.
methods.description: The type of permissions included are, BLUETOOTH, BLUTOOTH_ADMIN and ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission is provided at runtime by the app user. To request this permission use requestAccessFinePermission method

returns.summary: Returns true if all the permissions are granted.

methods.name: isSupported
methods.summary: Determines whether Bluetooth is supported on the local Bluetooth device.

returns.summary: Returns true if Bluetooth is supported on the device, false otherwise.

methods.name: requestAccessFinePermission
methods.summary: Request for the ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. This permission is necessary for the Bluetooth device to scan the nearby devices.
methods.description: If this permission is not requested, startDiscovery method will not be able to scan the nearby devices.

methods.name: setName
methods.summary: Sets the friendly Bluetooth name of the local Bluetooth adapter.
methods.description: The Bluetooth adapter must be turned on before you can set the name. After turning the Bluetooth on, wait for the stateChanged event with STATE_ON to get the updated value.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: Name for the local Bluetooth adapter. Bluetooth names can be maximum of 248 bytes using UTF-8 encoding. Although, it may vary upon Bluetooth devices. Some can only display first 40 characters, and some may be limited to just 20.

methods.name: startDiscovery
methods.description: This method starts the discovery for the nearby Bluetooth devices. The process of the discovery takes upto 12 seconds.This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately. Register for discoveryStarted and discoveryFinished events to determine exactly when discovery starts and completes. Register for deviceFound event to be notified when a nearby device is found. From API level 29 and above make sure that the location services is on in the device to start the scanning process. Device discovery will only find remote devices that are currently in discoverable mode. Many Bluetooth devices are not discoverable by default, and need to be entered into a discoverable mode. This method may return same device multiple times from the deviceFound event in span of 12 seconds. If Bluetooth state is not STATE_ON or the required permission not granted than this function will return false.

returns.summary: Returns true to indicate success, or false on immediate error.

properties.name: address
properties.summary: The hardware address of the local Bluetooth adapter.
properties.description: For example "00:11:22:AA:BB:CC". This method will only return valid address if the android API < 23. Otherwise, it will return a constant value of 02:00:00:00:00:00.

properties.name: name
properties.summary: Friendly name of the local Bluetooth adapter.
properties.description: This name is visible to remote Bluetooth devices. In case of error it can be null.

properties.name: scanMode
properties.summary: The current Bluetooth scan mode of the local Bluetooth adapter.
properties.description: The Bluetooth scan mode determines if the local adapter is connectable and/or discoverable from remote Bluetooth devices. Possible values are SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE, SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE_DISCOVERABLE and SCAN_MODE_NONE. If Bluetooth state is not STATE_ON, this API will return SCAN_MODE_NONE. After turning the Bluetooth on, wait for the stateChanged event with STATE_ON to get the updated value. If Bluetooth is not supported on the device, this property returns an error number which is different from the possible values.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: The current state of the local Bluetooth adapter.
properties.description: Possible values are STATE_OFF, STATE_ON, STATE_TURNING_OFF, STATE_TURNING_ON If Bluetooth is not supported on the device, this property returns an error number which is different from the possible values.

constants.name: DEVICE_TYPE_CLASSIC
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the type property.

constants.name: DEVICE_TYPE_DUAL
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the type property.

constants.name: DEVICE_TYPE_LE
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the type property.

constants.name: DEVICE_TYPE_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the type property.

constants.name: SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the scanMode property.
constants.description: This value indicates that inquiry scan is disabled, but page scan is enabled on the local Bluetooth adapter. Therefore this device is not discoverable from remote Bluetooth devices, but is connectable from remote Bluetooth devices that have previously discovered this devices.

constants.name: SCAN_MODE_CONNECTABLE_DISCOVERABLE
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the scanMode property.
constants.description: This value indicates that both inquiry scan and page scan are enabled on the local Bluetooth adapter. Therefore this device is both discoverable and connectable from remote Bluetooth devices.

constants.name: SCAN_MODE_NONE
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the scanMode property.
constants.description: This value indicated that both inquiry and page scan is disabled on the local Bluetooth adapter. Therefore this device neither discoverable nor connectable from the remote Bluetooth devices.

constants.name: STATE_OFF
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the state property. This value indicates that the local Bluetooth adapter is off.
constants.description: Listen for the stateChanged event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is off.

constants.name: STATE_ON
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the state property. This value indicates that the local Bluetooth adapter is on, and ready for use.
constants.description: Listen for the stateChanged event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is on.

constants.name: STATE_TURNING_OFF
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the state property. This value indicates that the local Bluetooth adapter is turning off.
constants.description: Listen for the stateChanged event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning off.

constants.name: STATE_TURNING_ON
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the state property. This value indicates that the local Bluetooth adapter is turning on.
constants.description: Listen for the stateChanged event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning on.
